Dagrad
  • API Reference
  • Main API
  • View page source

Main API

The following are the main function of the dagrad library. This is main function that calls the Working function of the library. User can explore different options to customize the learning process, by specifiying the method, the model, the loss function, the acyclicity constraint, the regularizer and the optimizer.

dagrad.learn(X, method='notears', model=None, loss_fn=None, h_fn=None, reg=None, optimizer=None, compute_lib=None, device=None, general_options=None, method_options=None, optimizer_options=None)[source]

This function learns the structure of a DAG from observational data using different methods. \(n\) number of samples, \(p\) number of features.

Parameters:

  • X (numpy.array of shape \((n, p)\)) – The data matrix.

  • method (str, default='notears') – The method to learn the DAG. One of ['notears', 'dagma', 'topo'].

  • model (str, default=None) – The model of data generating process . One of ['linear', 'nonlinear']. If None, it is set to 'linear'.

  • loss_fn (str, default=None) –

    The loss function to use. One of ['l2', 'logistic', 'logll', 'user_loss']. If None, it is set to 'l2'.

    • For 'user_loss', is not implemented yet, and it can be customized by the user.

  • h_fn (str, default=None) –

    The function to compute the acyclicity constraint. One of ['h_exp_sq', 'h_exp_abs', 'h_poly_sq', 'h_poly_abs', 'h_logdet_sq', 'h_logdet_abs', 'h_logdet_topo', 'h_logdet_abs', 'user_h']. If None, it is set to 'h_exp_sq'.

    • 'abs' stands for absolute value.

    • 'sq' stands for square.

    • 'poly' stands for polynomial.

    • 'logdet' stands for log determinant.

    • 'topo' is only specific to method 'topo'.

    • 'user_h' is not implemented yet, and it can be customized by the user.

  • reg (str, default=None) –

    The regularizer to use. One of ['l1', 'l2', 'mcp', 'none', 'user_reg']. If None, it is set to 'l1'.

    • 'user_reg' is not implemented yet, and it can be customized by the user.

    • 'mcp' stands for minimax concave penalty.

    • 'none' stands for no regularization.

  • optimizer (str, default=None) –

    The optimizer to use. One of ['lbfgs', 'adam', 'sklearn']. If None, it is set to 'lbfgs'.

    • 'sklearn' is only used for method 'topo'.

    • Method 'dagma' is only compatible with the 'adam' optimizer.

  • compute_lib (str, default=None) –

    The library to use for computation. One of ['numpy', 'torch']. If None, it is set to 'numpy'.

    All nonlinear models use torch for computation. Method 'topo' is only compatible with the 'numpy' compute_lib.

  • device (str, default=None) – The device to use for computation. One of ['cpu', 'cuda']. If None, it is set to 'cpu'.

  • general_options (dict, default=None) –

    General options for the method. If None, it is set to default values. Please refer to Options for more details.

    Allowed options are:

    • 'lambda1': float, default=0.1

      Weight for l1 penalty.

    • 'lambda2': float, default=0.01

      Weight for l2 penalty.

    • 'gamma': float, default=1.0

      Hyperparameter for (quasi-)MCP.

    • 'w_threshold': float, default=0.3

      Threshold for the output adjacency matrix.

    • 'initialization': None or np.ndarray or torch.Tensor or nn.Module, default=None

      Initialization for the parameters of the model.

    • 'tuning_method': str or None, default=None

      Method for tuning hyperparameters. One of 'cv', 'decay'.

    • 'K': int, default=5

      Number of folds for cross-validation.

    • 'reg_paras': list, default=None

      List of regularization parameters.

    • 'user_params': Any, default=None

      User-defined parameters.

  • method_options (dict, default=None) –

    Method-specific options for the method. If None, it is set to default values.

    More options are available for each method. Please refer to Options for more details, or check allowed_method_options in dagrad/utils/configure.py.

  • optimizer_options (dict, default=None) –

    Optimizer-specific options for the optimizer. If None, it is set to default values.

    More options are available for each optimizer. Please refer to Options for more details, or check allowed_optimizer_options in dagrad/utils/configure.py.

Returns:

W_est – The estimated adjacency matrix of the DAG.

Return type:

array-like of shape \((p, p)\)

Note

method_options and optimizer_options are dictionaries that can be used to specify the options for the method and the optimizer. If the method or the optimizer is not specified, the default value are used. If you want to learn how to customize the method or the optimizer, please refer to Options.

The following functions are wrappers for the NOTEARS [1] [2] [5], DAGMA [3], and TOPO [4]. When the following function are used, they will call the original implementation of the methods except for the TOPO method. The TOPO method implemented in the dagrad library works better than original implementation, so it is recommended to use the TOPO method from the dagrad library.

dagrad.notears(X, model='linear')[source]

This is a wrapper function for learn function with method notears, it calls the original notears implementation

Parameters:

  • X (numpy.array of shape \((n, p)\)) – The data matrix.

  • model (str, default='linear') – The model of data generating process .

Returns:

W_est – The estimated adjacency matrix of the DAG.

Return type:

numpy.array of shape \((p, p)\)

dagrad.dagma(X, model='linear')[source]

This is a wrapper function for learn function with method dagma, it calls the original dagma implementation

Parameters:

  • X (numpy.array of shape \((n, p)\)) – The data matrix.

  • model (str, default='linear') – The model of data generating process .

Returns:

W_est – The estimated adjacency matrix of the DAG.

Return type:

numpy.array of shape \((p, p)\)

dagrad.topo(X, model='linear')[source]

This is a wrapper function for learn function with method topo

Parameters:

  • X (numpy.array of shape \((n, p)\)) – The data matrix.

  • model (str, default='linear') – The model of data generating process .

Returns:

W_est – The estimated adjacency matrix of the DAG.

Return type:

numpy.array of shape \((p, p)\)

[1]

Zheng, Xun, Bryon Aragam, Pradeep K. Ravikumar, and Eric P. Xing. “Dags with no tears: Continuous optimization for structure learning.” Advances in neural information processing systems 31 (2018).

[2]

Zheng, Xun, Chen Dan, Bryon Aragam, Pradeep Ravikumar, and Eric Xing. “Learning sparse nonparametric dags.” In International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics, pp. 3414-3425. Pmlr, 2020.

[3]

Bello, Kevin, Bryon Aragam, and Pradeep Ravikumar. “Dagma: Learning dags via m-matrices and a log-determinant acyclicity characterization.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 35 (2022): 8226-8239.

[4]

Deng, Chang, Kevin Bello, Bryon Aragam, and Pradeep Kumar Ravikumar. “Optimizing NOTEARS objectives via topological swaps.” In International Conference on Machine Learning, pp. 7563-7595. PMLR, 2023.

[5]

Deng, Chang, Kevin Bello, Pradeep Kumar Ravikumar, and Bryon Aragam. “Likelihood-based differentiable structure learning” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 37 (2024)
